snippet: Private sector hiring rose and a government report noted modest expansion, data that fueled speculation over when the Federal Reserve would begin tapering its stimulus program.
abstract: ADP reports private employers added 215,000 new jobs in November; Institute for Supply Management says its services index fell to 53.9 in November from 55.4 in October; data fuels speculation over when the Federal Reserve will begin tapering its stimulus program.
lead_paragraph: Private sector hiring rose and a government report noted modest expansion, data that fueled speculation over when the Federal Reserve would begin tapering its stimulus program.

headline.main: Solid Economic Outlook in Swath of Data
headline.print_headline: Solid Economic Outlook in Swath of Data
